content:
#6729 adds some lemmas to make working with LeftRel more ergonomic, based on my recent experiences.

I'm not sure if these are all the right lemmas or if they are all necessary, but I think they might be - certainly my experience recently was that breaking down cases for LiftRel was harder to do than seemed strictly necessary.

The most important addition is probably @Alex J. Best 's suggestion of added [@mk_iff] to the definition of LiftRel. In a sense that feels to me the largest previous omission.
I precisely did not add mk_iff because I wanted to write a better lemma myself.

That's nice. I invite you to write it! Because I already wrote my version of it, essentially, and then Alex was like "oh you could just use 'mk_iff'". I'm not really at home to "oh well I could write a better version of this" unless it is accompanied by the better version.
I actually agree that the mk_iff version is not perfect, but it is the one that actually exists. If you let me know what you want the statement to be at least I can go and prove it, it won't be hard.
Hmm, not at a computer now, but my lemma should already be in the API?
I didn't find the lemma I needed, certainly.
The lemma that mk_iff makes gives an "exists" statement. We don't have any such lemma.

docs#Sum.liftRel_inl_inl might be what you mean, but those only work when things are already destructured. What I have added is a bunch of lemmas I needed for my other work, that we didn't have. I am open to suggestions on how to change that but I'm not adding stuff for the sake of it - I need these lemmas.
Do you have a branch that uses the new iff lemma?
